canonical_explanation.text: Solid shapes are 3D shapes that have length, width, and height. Unlike flat shapes, you can hold solid shapes in your hand. The main solid shapes are: cube (like a dice), cuboid (like a brick), cylinder (like a tin can), sphere (like a ball), and cone (like an ice cream cone). Some solids can roll, some can stack, and some can do both.
rules: A sphere is round like a ball — it can roll.
A cube has 6 flat square faces — it can stack.
A cuboid has 6 flat rectangular faces — it can stack.
A cylinder has 2 flat circular faces and a curved surface — it can roll and stack.
A cone has 1 flat circular face and a pointed top — it can roll on its side.

questions.question_text: A ball is an example of which solid shape?
questions.explanation_correct: A ball is a sphere — it is perfectly round from all sides.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A ball is round from every direction. This shape is called a sphere.

questions.question_text: A dice is an example of which solid shape?
questions.explanation_correct: A dice is a cube — it has 6 square faces, all the same size.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A dice has 6 equal square faces. This shape is called a cube.

questions.question_text: A tin can is an example of which solid shape?
questions.explanation_correct: A tin can is a cylinder — it has two flat circular faces and a curved surface.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A tin can has round ends and a curved body. This is a cylinder.

questions.question_text: An ice cream cone is shaped like which solid?
questions.explanation_correct: An ice cream cone is shaped like a cone — it has a pointed end and a round open end.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An ice cream cone has a pointy bottom and a round top — this is a cone shape.

questions.question_text: A brick is an example of which solid shape?
questions.explanation_correct: A brick is a cuboid — it has 6 rectangular faces.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A brick has flat rectangular faces. This shape is called a cuboid.

questions.question_text: Which everyday object is shaped like a cylinder?
questions.explanation_correct: A glass is shaped like a cylinder — round at the top and bottom with a curved surface.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A glass has circular openings and a curved body. This is a cylinder shape.

questions.question_text: Which everyday object is shaped like a sphere?
questions.explanation_correct: A football is round from all sides — it is a sphere.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A football is round like a ball. Balls are spheres.

questions.question_text: Which object is shaped like a cuboid?
questions.explanation_correct: A lunchbox is a cuboid — it has flat rectangular faces.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A lunchbox has rectangular faces and looks like a box. This is a cuboid.

questions.question_text: Is a ball a flat shape or a solid shape?
questions.explanation_correct: A ball is a solid shape (sphere). You can hold it in your hand.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A ball is a solid shape. Flat shapes (like circles) can only be drawn on paper.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a flat shape, NOT a solid shape?
questions.explanation_correct: A circle is a flat shape. Sphere, cube, and cylinder are solid shapes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A circle is flat (2D). Sphere, cube, and cylinder are solid (3D) shapes.

questions.question_text: Which solid shape can roll in any direction?
questions.explanation_correct: A sphere (ball) can roll in any direction because it is round everywhere.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A sphere is round from all sides, so it rolls freely in any direction.

questions.question_text: Which solid shape can be stacked easily on top of another?
questions.explanation_correct: A cube has flat faces, so it can be stacked easily.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cubes have flat faces on all sides, making them easy to stack. Spheres roll away.

questions.question_text: Can a cylinder roll?

options.text: No, it cannot roll at all
Only if it is very small

questions.explanation_correct: A cylinder can roll on its curved surface. It can also stand on its flat face.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cylinder has a curved side, so it can roll. It also has flat ends for stacking.

questions.question_text: A sphere can be stacked easily.
questions.explanation_correct: False. A sphere is round and rolls away. It cannot be stacked easily.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is false. Spheres have no flat faces, so they roll and cannot stack.

questions.question_text: A cuboid has flat faces.
questions.explanation_correct: True. A cuboid has 6 flat rectangular faces.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. A cuboid (like a box) has flat rectangular faces on all sides.

questions.question_text: A birthday cap (party hat) looks like which solid shape?
questions.explanation_correct: A birthday cap is shaped like a cone — pointed at the top.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A birthday cap is pointy at the top with a round base — this is a cone.

questions.question_text: A Rubik's cube is shaped like which solid?
questions.explanation_correct: A Rubik's cube is a cube — all faces are squares of equal size.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A Rubik's cube has 6 equal square faces. This makes it a cube.

questions.question_text: A circle is flat. What is the solid shape version of a circle?
questions.explanation_correct: A sphere is the 3D version of a circle — round from all directions.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A circle is flat and round. A sphere is round in 3D — like a ball.

questions.question_text: A shape that looks like a ball is called a ____.
questions.explanation_correct: A ball-shaped solid is called a sphere.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The solid shape that looks like a ball is called a sphere.

questions.question_text: A shape that looks like a box with all square faces is called a ____.
questions.explanation_correct: A box with all square faces is called a cube.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A solid with 6 equal square faces is a cube.

questions.question_text: Which of these is shaped like a cone?
questions.explanation_correct: An ice cream cone is shaped like a cone — pointed at one end.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An ice cream cone has a point and a round opening — this is a cone shape.

questions.question_text: Which of these can both roll AND stack?
questions.explanation_correct: A cylinder can roll (on its curved side) and stack (on its flat ends).
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cylinder has a curved surface (for rolling) and flat circular ends (for stacking).

questions.question_text: A log of wood is shaped like which solid?
questions.explanation_correct: A log of wood is shaped like a cylinder — round at the ends with a curved surface.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A wooden log has round cross-sections and a long curved body — like a cylinder.

questions.question_text: Which is a solid shape?
questions.explanation_correct: A cuboid is a solid shape. Circle, square, and triangle are flat shapes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Circles, squares, and triangles are flat (2D). A cuboid is a 3D solid shape.

questions.question_text: A cube can roll easily.
questions.explanation_correct: False. A cube has flat faces and corners, so it cannot roll easily.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is false. Cubes have flat faces and sharp edges. They do not roll.

questions.question_text: A globe (model of Earth) is which solid shape?
questions.explanation_correct: A globe is a sphere — round from all directions.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A globe is round like a ball, which makes it a sphere.

questions.question_text: Why can you stack bricks on top of each other?
questions.explanation_correct: Bricks have flat faces, so they sit on top of each other without rolling.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Flat faces allow objects to be stacked. Bricks are cuboids with flat faces.

questions.question_text: A joker's cap at a birthday party is shaped like a:
questions.explanation_correct: A joker's cap is cone-shaped — pointed at the top with a round base.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A party/joker cap has a point and a round base — cone shape.

questions.question_text: A square is a flat shape. What solid shape has all square faces?
questions.explanation_correct: A cube has 6 square faces. It is the solid version of a square.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cube has all 6 faces as squares. A cuboid has rectangular faces.

questions.question_text: A drum is shaped like which solid?
questions.explanation_correct: A drum is shaped like a cylinder — round at both ends.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A drum has two flat round faces connected by a curved surface — like a cylinder.

questions.question_text: Riya wants to stack shapes to build a tower. Which shapes should she use?
questions.explanation_correct: Cubes and cuboids have flat faces and stack well. Spheres roll and cones tip over.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Shapes with flat faces (cubes, cuboids) are best for stacking.

questions.question_text: A cone has a pointed top.
questions.explanation_correct: True. A cone has a pointed top and a flat circular base.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Cones are pointed at one end.

questions.question_text: A dosa rolled into a tube shape looks like which solid?
questions.explanation_correct: A rolled dosa looks like a cylinder — round and tube-shaped.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A rolled dosa forms a tube shape, which is a cylinder.

questions.question_text: A rectangle is a solid shape.
questions.explanation_correct: False. A rectangle is a flat (2D) shape. A cuboid is the solid version.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is false. A rectangle is flat. You cannot pick it up like a box.

questions.question_text: Which shape would roll down a slope the fastest?
questions.explanation_correct: A sphere rolls fastest because it is round everywhere with no flat faces to stop it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Spheres roll freely in all directions. Cubes and cuboids have flat faces and do not roll.

questions.question_text: A matchbox is shaped like which solid?
questions.explanation_correct: A matchbox is a cuboid — it has rectangular faces.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A matchbox has rectangular faces of different sizes — this is a cuboid.

questions.question_text: A solid shape with a curved surface and two flat circular faces is a ____.
questions.explanation_correct: A cylinder has 2 flat circular faces and a curved surface.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cylinder has two flat circles (top and bottom) and a curved side.

questions.question_text: Aarav has a cylinder and a cube. Which one can he roll?
questions.explanation_correct: Only the cylinder can roll (on its curved surface). The cube has flat faces and cannot roll.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The cylinder has a curved surface for rolling. The cube has only flat faces.

questions.question_text: An orange is shaped like which solid?
questions.explanation_correct: An orange is round like a ball — it is a sphere.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Oranges are round from all sides, making them spheres.

questions.question_text: How is a flat shape different from a solid shape?

options.text: Flat shapes can only be drawn on paper; solid shapes can be held

questions.explanation_correct: Flat shapes are 2D (drawn on paper). Solid shapes are 3D (can be held in hand).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Flat shapes like circles exist on paper. Solid shapes like spheres can be picked up and held.

questions.question_text: A cylinder has two flat circular faces.
questions.explanation_correct: True. A cylinder has a flat circle on the top and another on the bottom.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Cylinders have two flat round faces connected by a curved surface.

questions.question_text: A funnel looks most like which solid shape?
questions.explanation_correct: A funnel looks like a cone — wide at the top and narrow at the bottom.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A funnel is cone-shaped: it has a wide open end and narrows to a point.

questions.question_text: Why do wheels need to be round?
questions.explanation_correct: Round shapes roll smoothly. Square wheels would bump along.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Wheels are round (circular/spherical) so they can roll smoothly on the ground.

questions.question_text: A shape with a flat circular base and a pointed top is a ____.
questions.explanation_correct: A flat circular base with a pointed top is a cone.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cone has one circular face at the bottom and comes to a point at the top.

questions.question_text: The flat face of a cube is which shape?
questions.explanation_correct: Each face of a cube is a square.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cube has 6 faces, and each face is a square.

questions.question_text: A pipe is shaped like which solid?
questions.explanation_correct: A pipe is shaped like a cylinder — round and hollow.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Pipes have circular cross-sections and are tube-shaped — like cylinders.

questions.question_text: Diya placed a cube, a cylinder, and a sphere at the top of a ramp. Which ones will roll down?
questions.explanation_correct: The cylinder and sphere will roll because they have curved surfaces. The cube will not roll.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Shapes with curved surfaces roll. The sphere and cylinder have curved parts. The cube has only flat faces.

questions.question_text: A cuboid has 6 faces.
questions.explanation_correct: True. A cuboid has 6 flat rectangular faces.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. A cuboid (like a box) has 6 faces: top, bottom, front, back, left, right.

questions.question_text: A ladoo is shaped like which solid?
questions.explanation_correct: A ladoo is round like a ball — it is a sphere.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Ladoos are round from all sides, which makes them spheres.

questions.question_text: The flat face of a cylinder is which shape?
questions.explanation_correct: The flat face of a cylinder is a circle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cylinder has 2 flat faces, and each face is a circle.
